linux.title: Linux Systems
linux.description: SysManage supports the following open-source antivirus solutions on Linux:
linux.clamav: ClamAV - Cross-platform antivirus engine for detecting trojans, viruses, malware, and other malicious threats
linux.chkrootkit: chkrootkit - Tool to check for signs of a rootkit
linux.rkhunter: rkhunter - Rootkit Hunter scans for rootkits, backdoors, and local exploits

bsd.title: BSD Systems
bsd.description: BSD platforms support ClamAV and rkhunter:

windows.title: Windows
windows.service: Windows service integration for real-time protection

defaults.title: Setting Default Antivirus Software
defaults.description: SysManage allows administrators to define which antivirus software should be deployed for each operating system. These defaults are used when deploying antivirus to hosts.
defaults.step1: Navigate to Settings in the main menu
defaults.step3: For each operating system, select the desired antivirus package from the dropdown
defaults.step4: Select "None" to disable automatic antivirus deployment for that OS
defaults.permissions_description: Managing antivirus defaults requires the MANAGE_ANTIVIRUS_DEFAULTS security role. Contact your administrator if you need this permission.

deployment.title: Deploying Antivirus Software
deployment.overview_description: Antivirus deployment in SysManage is a fully automated process that installs and configures the antivirus software appropriate for the target host's operating system.

requirements.title: Prerequisites
requirements.active_host: Host must be active and connected to the server
requirements.privileged_agent: Agent must be running with elevated privileges (root/administrator)
requirements.default_configured: A default antivirus package must be configured for the host's operating system
requirements.network: Host must have internet access to download antivirus packages

steps.title: Deploying via Web Interface
steps.step1: Navigate to Hosts in the main menu
steps.step2: Click on the desired host to view its details
steps.step3: Scroll to the Antivirus card on the host detail page
steps.step4: If no antivirus is detected, you will see a "Deploy Antivirus" button
steps.step6: Confirm the deployment in the dialog that appears
steps.step7: Monitor the deployment progress - the antivirus card will update when deployment completes

process.title: What Happens During Deployment
process.description: The deployment process varies slightly by platform but generally follows these steps:

linux_bsd.step2: ClamAV and related packages are downloaded and installed
linux_bsd.step3: freshclam service is enabled and started (updates virus definitions)
linux_bsd.step4: clamd service is enabled and started (real-time scanning daemon)
linux_bsd.step5: Initial virus definition update is performed
linux_bsd.step6: Agent reports deployment status back to server

macos.step2: freshclam is configured and virus definitions are updated
macos.step3: ClamAV service is started via brew services

windows.step1: ClamAV for Windows installer is downloaded
windows.step3: ClamAV Windows service is configured and started

monitoring.title: Monitoring Antivirus Status
monitoring.overview_description: SysManage agents automatically detect installed antivirus software and report status information to the server. This information is displayed in real-time on the host detail page.

status.title: Status Information Displayed
status.software_name: Software Name: The name of the detected antivirus software (e.g., "ClamAV")
status.version: Version: The installed version of the antivirus software
status.install_path: Installation Path: Where the antivirus software is installed
status.enabled_state: Enabled/Disabled: Whether the antivirus service is currently running
status.last_updated: Last Updated: When the status information was last refreshed

viewing.title: Viewing Antivirus Status
viewing.step1: Navigate to Hosts in the main menu
viewing.step3: Scroll to the Antivirus section on the host detail page
viewing.step4: Status information is displayed in a card with a shield icon

indicators.title: Status Indicators
indicators.enabled: Enabled (Green): Antivirus is installed and actively running
indicators.disabled: Disabled (Yellow): Antivirus is installed but not running
indicators.not_installed: Not Installed (Gray): No antivirus software detected on the host

enable.title: Enabling Antivirus
enable.description: If antivirus is installed but disabled, you can enable it remotely:
enable.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
enable.step2: In the Antivirus card, click Enable Antivirus
enable.step3: Confirm the action in the dialog
enable.step4: The agent will start the antivirus service and report the new status

disable.title: Disabling Antivirus
disable.description: To temporarily disable antivirus without removing it:
disable.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
disable.step2: In the Antivirus card, click Disable Antivirus
disable.step3: Confirm the action in the dialog
disable.step4: The agent will stop the antivirus service
disable.warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Security Warning: Disabling antivirus leaves the system vulnerable to malware. Only disable antivirus when necessary for troubleshooting.

remove.title: Removing Antivirus
remove.description: To completely remove antivirus software from a host:
remove.step1: Navigate to the host detail page
remove.step2: In the Antivirus card, click Remove Antivirus
remove.step5: The agent will stop services, uninstall packages, and clean up configuration files
remove.warning1: Antivirus removal is irreversible from the web interface
remove.warning2: System will be unprotected after removal
remove.warning3: Virus definition databases and logs will be deleted
remove.warning4: Use the "Deploy Antivirus" button to reinstall if needed

security_roles.title: Security Roles
security_roles.deploy: Allows user to deploy antivirus software to hosts
security_roles.enable: Allows user to enable antivirus services on hosts
security_roles.disable: Allows user to disable antivirus services on hosts
security_roles.remove: Allows user to completely remove antivirus software from hosts
security_roles.manage_defaults: Allows user to configure default antivirus packages per operating system

deploy_button_disabled.title: Deploy Button is Disabled
deploy_button_disabled.cause1: No default antivirus package is configured for this OS - configure one in Settings > Antivirus
deploy_button_disabled.cause2: Host is not active or not connected
deploy_button_disabled.cause3: Agent is not running with elevated privileges
deploy_button_disabled.cause4: You don't have the DEPLOY_ANTIVIRUS security role
deploy_button_disabled.cause5: Antivirus is already deployed on this host

deployment_failed.title: Deployment Failed
deployment_failed.solution1: Check host's internet connectivity - package downloads require internet access
deployment_failed.solution2: Verify package manager is working correctly on the host
deployment_failed.solution3: Check agent logs on the host for detailed error messages
deployment_failed.solution4: Ensure sufficient disk space is available
deployment_failed.solution5: On macOS, verify Homebrew is installed and working

status_not_updating.title: Status Not Updating
status_not_updating.solution2: Check if the agent is connected and active
status_not_updating.solution3: Status updates occur during agent check-in cycles (typically every few minutes)
status_not_updating.solution4: Check agent logs for errors in antivirus detection

permission_denied.title: Permission Denied Errors
permission_denied.solution: Solution: Contact your administrator to request the appropriate security role(s) for antivirus management.

deploy_early.title: Deploy Early
deploy_early.description: Deploy antivirus software immediately after host approval for maximum protection.

monitor_regularly.title: Monitor Regularly
monitor_regularly.description: Regularly review antivirus status across your infrastructure to ensure all systems are protected.

test_deployments.title: Test Deployments
test_deployments.description: Test antivirus deployment on non-production hosts before rolling out to production systems.

role_based_access.title: Use Role-Based Access Control
role_based_access.description: Restrict antivirus management permissions to trusted administrators only, especially REMOVE_ANTIVIRUS and DISABLE_ANTIVIRUS roles.

standards.title: Maintain Consistent Standards
standards.description: Use the default configuration feature to ensure consistent antivirus deployment across all hosts of the same operating system.

privileged_agents.title: Run Agents with Privileges
privileged_agents.description: Ensure agents run with elevated privileges (root/administrator) to enable full antivirus management capabilities.

privileged_mode.description: The SysManage agent must be running in privileged mode (as root or Administrator) to create user accounts and groups. If the agent is not running in privileged mode, the Add User and Add Group buttons will be disabled.
privileged_mode.check_description: The host detail page shows whether the agent is running in privileged mode. Look for the "Agent Privileged" indicator in the host information section.
privileged_mode.warning_description: Running the agent in privileged mode grants it elevated system access. Only enable privileged mode on hosts where you need account management or other privileged operations.

security.description: Host account management operations are protected by role-based access control (RBAC). Users must have specific security roles to create accounts and groups.

security.role_add_group: ADD_HOST_GROUP: Required to create groups on hosts

troubleshooting.button_disabled_symptoms: Symptoms: The Add User or Add Group button is grayed out
troubleshooting.button_disabled_solution1: Verify the agent is running in privileged mode
troubleshooting.button_disabled_solution2: Check that you have the required ADD_HOST_ACCOUNT or ADD_HOST_GROUP role
troubleshooting.button_disabled_solution3: Ensure the host is active and connected
troubleshooting.creation_fails_solution1: Check that the username/group name doesn't already exist
troubleshooting.creation_fails_solution2: Verify the UID/GID isn't already in use
troubleshooting.creation_fails_solution3: Review agent logs for detailed error messages
troubleshooting.creation_fails_solution4: Ensure the specified shell exists on the target system
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution1: Verify your user account has the required role (ADD_HOST_ACCOUNT or ADD_HOST_GROUP)
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution2: Contact administrator to request host account management permissions
troubleshooting.permission_denied_solution3: Refresh your session after role changes
troubleshooting.list_not_updating_symptoms: Symptoms: Created user/group doesn't appear in the list
troubleshooting.list_not_updating_solution1: Wait a few moments for the agent to report updated data
troubleshooting.list_not_updating_solution2: Click "Request Host Data" to force an immediate update
troubleshooting.list_not_updating_solution3: Check WebSocket connection status in browser console

best_practices.naming_practice3: Use descriptive group names that indicate purpose
best_practices.security_practice1: Grant host account management roles only to trusted administrators

best_practices.security_practice3: Use separate service accounts for applications rather than shared accounts
best_practices.security_practice4: Implement password policies for Windows accounts
best_practices.operational_practice1: Create groups before creating users that need to belong to them
best_practices.operational_practice2: Document custom UID/GID assignments to avoid conflicts
best_practices.operational_practice3: Test account creation on non-production hosts first
